title: Reconfiguration of Independent Transversals
authors: Pjotr Buys and Ross J. Kang and Kenta Ozeki
abstract:
Given integers $\Delta\ge 2$ and $t\ge 2\Delta$, suppose there is a graph of
maximum degree $\Delta$ and a partition of its vertices into blocks of size at
least $t$. By a seminal result of Haxell, there must be some independent set of
the graph that is transversal to the blocks, a so-called independent
transversal. We show that, if moreover $t\ge2\Delta+1$, then every independent
transversal can be transformed within the space of independent transversals to
any other through a sequence of one-vertex modifications, showing connectivity
of the so-called reconfigurability graph of independent transversals.
  This is sharp in that for $t=2\Delta$ (and $\Delta\ge 2$) the connectivity
conclusion can fail. In this case we show furthermore that in an essential
sense it can only fail for the disjoint union of copies of the complete
bipartite graph $K_{\Delta,\Delta}$. This constitutes a qualitative
strengthening of Haxell's theorem.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Data Structures and Algorithms
